name: STAT 131
title: Introduction to Probability Theory
description: Introduction to probability theory and its applications. Combinatorial analysis, axioms of probability and independence, random variables (discrete and continuous), joint probability distributions, properties of expectation, Central Limit Theorem, Law of Large Numbers, Markov chains. Students cannot receive credit for this course and STAT 203 and CMPE 107. (Formerly AMS 131.)

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): AM 11B or ECON 11B or MATH 11B or MATH 19B or MATH 20B.
